articles.name: Server Member Applications
articles.title: Server Member Applications
articles.body:
Learn how to manage Discord server members through applications, invite-only settings, and server discovery. Here we'll show you everything server owners need to know about controlling member access, reviewing applications, and customizing join requirements.

What this article covers:
  • Understanding Server Member Applications
  • How to Configure Server Join Settings
    • Invite Only
    • Apply to Join
    • Discoverable
  • Reviewing Server Member Applications
    • Processing Server Member Applications
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Understanding Server Member Applications

The server member applications feature is rolling out gradually and can only be enabled through the desktop app. However, users applying for a server can submit or withdraw their applications using either desktop or mobile devices.

People can join your server in three ways:

  • Invite only
  • Through Discovery
  • Member application

Using member applications, server owners can precisely control who joins their server. Simply navigate to your Access settings, by pressing the server name in the upper-left corner. Then select Server Settings > Access.

Accessing Server Member Applications

How to Configure Server Join Settings

In Access settings, you can control your server's privacy level by choosing how people join. Select either Invite Only, Apply to Join, or Discoverable under the How can people join your server? section.

Server Join Setting Options: Invite Only, Apply to Join, and Discoverable

Invite Only

Invite Only is the default privacy setting for all Discord servers. This gives you maximum control over who joins your server:

  • Members can only join through valid invite links
  • Enable server rules to require new members to accept your server guidelines before participating
  • Generate customized invite links with expiration dates and usage limits

Invite Only Option

Apply to Join

While applications are pending, users cannot view any server content.

With the Apply to Join option, you can screen potential members by requiring them to complete an application form before joining your server. Here's what you need to know:

  • All applications must be reviewed and approved by server administrators before members can join
  • Create custom questions to ensure new members are a good fit for your community
  • Choose whether to display application links on server profiles for easier discovery

Apply to Join Option

NOTE: Server members who have the Kick Members permission enabled can create special invite links that bypass the application process. These invite links can be viewed in Server Settings > Invites.

Discoverable

The Discoverable option lets you enable Server Discovery, making your server visible to all Discord users who are searching for new communities:

  • Your server must be set up as a Community server to be discoverable
  • You'll need to meet Discord's discovery eligibility requirements including safety standards
  • Anyone can join and find your server directly through Server Discovery

Discoverable Option

Reviewing Server Member Applications

If your server’s privacy level was set to Apply to Join, server administrators with the appropriate permissions can manage member applications through the Members page. You can learn more about the Members page here.

If a user has applied to join your server, you will notice a notification located next to the Members tab located above the server’s channel list. In the Members page, select the user’s server member application.

You will be able to review the following information:

  • Why they would like to join your server
  • When they joined Discord
  • When they submitted their server member application

Reviewing a Server Members Application in Members Page

Processing Server Member Applications

When reviewing server member applications, you have three processing options:

  • Approve: This grants the user access to your server.
  • Reject: This denies the user access to your server. To permanently prevent a user from reapplying, you can ban them from the server.
  • Interview: You can choose to directly message and interview the user before making your final decision to approve or reject their application.

Example of Selecting Interview

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long does it take to review server member applications?

A: The review time varies depending on your server administrators' availability. There is no set timeframe.

Q: Can users edit their server member applications after submitting?

A: No, users cannot edit their applications after submission. However, they can withdraw their application and submit a new one if needed.

Q: Who can review server member applications?

A: Server administrators and members with appropriate permissions (specifically those with the Kick Members permission) can review and process member applications.

Q: What happens if a server member application is rejected?

A: When an application is rejected, the user will be notified and will not gain access to the server. They can choose to apply again unless they have been banned by server administrators.

Q: Can I customize the server member application questions?

A: Yes, server administrators can create custom questions to better screen potential members and ensure they're a good fit for the community.

Q: Do server member applications work on mobile devices?

A: While the feature can only be enabled through the desktop app, users can submit and withdraw applications using either desktop or mobile devices.

articles.name: 3 Months YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.title: 3 Months YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro Users Promo FAQ
articles.body:
Starting from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), Discord Nitro members can claim 3 months of YouTube Premium. Read more below about the promotion below.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 3 months of YouTube Premium for Discord Nitro member

Who is Eligible: To claim through Discord, you must be a current Nitro member (unable to be redeemed if you have a Nitro trial membership

Requirements:

Users located in the United States, Canada, France, Germany, United Kingdom, Japan, and Korea can claim through Discord Gift Inventory from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), and redeem in your YouTube account by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Subscription:

After the 3 month free trial period, your YouTube Premium subscription will convert to a monthly or yearly recurring subscription, and YouTube will bill your payment method unless you cancel the subscription.

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is YouTube Premium? 
  • How do I claim the YouTube Premium in Discord? 
    • Eligibility for Claiming this Promotion in Discord
    • Step By Step Claim Instructions 
  • How do I redeem the YouTube Premium on my YouTube Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the YouTube Premium
  • How do I share my Code with a Friend?
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Claiming and Redemption Process
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is YouTube Premium?

YouTube Premium. All YouTube. No interruptions. Now you can watch videos ad-free, keep them playing in the background, and download them to watch anytime, anywhere. You even get uninterrupted access to the YouTube Music app where you can listen to over 100 million official songs ad-free, offline, and in the background. With YouTube Premium, there’s nothing stopping you from playing your favorites. Learn more here.

How do I claim the YouTube Premium in Discord?

As long as you're a Discord Nitro member, you'll be able to claim the YouTube Premium code in the Gift Inventory from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for the Claiming this Promotion in Discord

In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro, (and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member).

  • If you are an active Discord Nitro member, the code must be claimed in the Gift Inventory by April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).
    • Otherwise, the code will not be available to claim after April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).  

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to become a Nitro member in order to claim this promotion.

Step By Step Claim Instructions 

1) Log into Your Discord account and head to the Gift Inventory tab. 

If you’re a Discord Nitro member, start by logging into your Discord account. 

You may notice a notification bar at the top of your browser/desktop app, and you can press the "Take me there" button in the notification bar to be redirected to your Gift Inventory. 

For both the desktop/browser app and mobile app, you can also directly head to your User Settings, and then select Gift Inventory.

2) Click on the Claim button for the YouTube Premium Gift

Once you press Claim on the YouTube Premium Gift in the Gift Inventory and you'll then see a new pop-up with your 12 character code for this promotion.

If you want to redeem your code later, you can press the Maybe Later button, and then redeem the code before May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

How do I redeem the YouTube Premium Trial on my YouTube Account?

Once you have claimed the code in the Gift Inventory, you'll now need to officially redeem this code on your YouTube account (or share this code with a friend).

Eligibility for Redeeming the YouTube Premium Trial

To redeem the 3 months YouTube Premium trial code, this offer is only for eligible potential YouTube Premium subscribers. Learn more here.

Note: If you're running into any issues when attempting to redeem this promotion, and you believe that your YouTube account meets the promotion requirements, reach out to the YouTube support team to review your YouTube account further through here.

How do I share my Code with a Friend?

If you're unable to claim this code on your own YouTube account, you'll be able to share this code with a friend to use instead.

To share the code, you can copy the 12-character code from the Gift Inventory (in your User Settings in the Discord app) and then share this code to a friend in a Direct Message.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Claiming and Redemption Process
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion for Nitro members run for?

A: This promotion runs from January 21, 2025 (10:00AM PT) to April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

After April 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), Nitro members will no longer be able to claim a trial code.

Q: How long does my YouTube Premium code last for in my Gift Inventory?

A: Once a code is claimed in the Gift Inventory in Discord, all YouTube Premium codes must be redeemed by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the YouTube account by May 15, 2025 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to claim 3 months of YouTube Premium.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion in the Discord Gift Inventory?

A: All current and new Nitro members are eligible for this perk. 

This does not include Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boost-only members.

Q: Who can redeem this YouTube Premium trial to their YouTube account?

A: Users located in the United States, Canada, France, Germany, United Kingdom, Japan, and Korea can redeem the promo that has not had YouTube premium before. Extended trials are available to first-time members OR 3 years after canceling your previous membership. Learn more here.

Only 1 extended trial is allowed per 3 year period.

Q: Can I redeem the YouTube Premium promotion to my YouTube account in my region? 

A: In order to check whether or not you meet the eligibility requirements to redeem this YouTube promotion, please make sure to review this link for the full details here.

Claiming and Redemption Process

Q: On which Discord platforms can I claim this promotion?

A: You'll be able to claim the promo on the mobile, browser, and desktop version of the Discord app.


Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem the YouTube Premium trial?

A: Because YouTube Premium is a subscription plan, at the end of your free 3 month trial, your first billing cycle starts so you can continue to enjoy YouTube Premium.

However, you can cancel the YouTube Premium subscription at any time before the end of the 3 months.

If you need further support with your account, you can reach out to YouTube's support team here.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: What if I don't see the YouTube Premium code in my Discord Gift Inventory? 

A: In order to claim this code, you'll need to be an active member to Discord Nitro (not on a Nitro trial) and you can be either a monthly or yearly Nitro member.

Unfortunately, if you are a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting member, you'll need to become a Nitro member in order to claim this promotion.

If you are an active Discord Nitro member, make sure to refresh your Discord client to double check if an update was needed.

  • What if I'm still running into issues? 
    • If the refresh does not work, please submit a ticket through our support system at: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.
    • Be sure to submit the ticket using the email address associated with your Discord account, and send us a screenshot of the following: 
      1. Your My Account tab
      2. Your Gift Inventory tab

Q: I'm having trouble redeeming this promotion to my YouTube account. How do I contact YouTube support? 

A: If you are having issues redeeming this promotion on your YouTube account, you can reach out to YouTube support here.

articles.name: How to Maintain your Nitro and Server Boost Subscription Streaks
articles.title: How to Maintain your Nitro and Server Boost Subscription Streaks
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is a Subscription Streak?
  • How to Maintain Your Nitro Badge Subscription Streak
  • How to Maintain Your Server Boost Subscription Streak
  • How do I Transfer my Server Boost to Maintain my streak?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is a Subscription Streak?

Nitro and Server Boosting Badge streaks

A subscription streak is how long you’ve been subscribed to Nitro or Server Boosting a server. The longer you’ve consistently been subscribed, the bigger your streak will be. Your streak can be reset if you are no longer subscribed to Nitro or if you’re not actively boosting a server with a Server Boost.

How to Maintain Your Nitro Badge Subscription Streak

Example of Nitro Badge and subscription streak

Any user that has a Nitro, Nitro Basic, or Nitro Classic subscription will have a Nitro badge on their profile. In order to maintain your Nitro badge streak, you must remain subscribed to Nitro, Nitro Basic, or Nitro Classic. 

If your subscription has ended, you have 3 days to renew your subscription in order to maintain your streak.

You can view your boosting streak by tapping on your avatar icon to reveal your profile and hovering over your Nitro badge.

GIF showing how to view your Nitro badge streak

Note: If your subscription streak has been lost, our Support Team can not adjust your streak.

How to Maintain Your Server Boost Subscription Streak

Note: If you have been removed or left a server that you were boosting, you will have a 7 day cooldown before you can use your boost again. Learn more about transferring a boost below.

If you are also switching your purchase from desktop to mobile or vice versa, you have 72 hours to manually reactivate your Server Boosts in order to not lose your streak.

Server Boosting Badge Streak through User Profile

Your Server Boosting Badge and streak is based on the length of time that you started boosting a server. 

Note: Regardless of how many servers you boost, the length of your streak is dependent on the oldest applied server boost(s)

You can view your boosting streak by tapping on your avatar icon to reveal your profile and hovering over your Server Boosting badge.

GIF showing how to view your Server Boosting badge streak

You can lose your boosting streak for any of the following reasons:

  • You cancel your Server Boost(s)
  • Your Nitro (with 2 included Server Boosts) or your Server Boost(s) subscription has ended
  • The server you have been boosting has been deleted 
  • You’ve been removed from the server by an admin or moderator
Note: If you stop boosting a server for any of the listed reasons, you have 72 hours to reapply your boosts to a new server in order to maintain your streak. If you do not boost another server within 72 hours, you will lose your streak and our Support Team can not adjust your streak.

As long as you keep boosting your favorite server, that badge will continue to evolve while you reach extra levels. 

Example of Server Boost Badge streak evolution                                      

How do I Transfer my Server Boost to Maintain my Streak?

Note: After using your Server Boost, you’ll need to wait 7 days for the cooldown before transferring it to another server.

If you accidentally boosted the wrong server, or you just want to move your boost, you can easily transfer your Server Boost to another server! Just keep in mind, if you move your boost to another server, the original server might lose a server boost level. Here’s how to transfer your boost.

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

 

Cogwheel Icon on Desktop/Browser

2. Navigate to the Server Boost tab.

3. Here you should see the current servers that your Server Boosts are applied to. Tap on the ellipsis [] to the Server Boost that you want to move, and then tap on Transfer Boost.

4. You can either search for the name of the server you want to transfer the boost to, or you can tap on Transfer here if you see the server in the list. In order for a server to show up in the list, you must be a member of the server.

5. Now just tap on Yes, Transfer Boost to transfer the Server Boost.

6. Finally you’ll see a confirmation message stating it has been transferred successfully.

Example of Transferring a Server Boost to Another Server

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: My streak reset and I believe this is incorrect, what should I do? 

A: Discord cannot restore streaks under any circumstances. If you think your streak was incorrectly reset, first verify that you have an active subscription.

If your subscription expired due to past due payments and you had to restart it, remember to manually reapply your server boosts within 72 hours of reactivating your Nitro subscription.

Q: My streak date appears incorrect. What should I do?

A: The streak calculation differs between products: Nitro subscription streaks are based on the subscription date, while Server Boost streaks start from when you begin boosting a server. Since purchases use Universal Time (UTC), the displayed date may differ by up to 24 hours from your local time.

articles.name: How to Connect your Bluesky account to Discord
articles.title: How to Connect your Bluesky account to Discord
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is Bluesky?
  • How to Connect Bluesky to your Discord Account
  • An Unknown Error Occurred. Maybe check your handle?
  • Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky
    • Custom PDS Providers
    • did:web: accounts

What is Bluesky?

Bluesky is a social media platform that allows you to post short messages, photos, videos and more. 

How to Connect Bluesky to your Discord Account

1. Head into your User Settings by pressing the cogwheel [] icon.

2. Tap on the Connections tab and then the Bluesky butterfly icon. 

Connections tab under User Settings

3. Type in your handle for Bluesky and then follow the on-screen instructions to connect your account.

Example of where you enter your Bluesky Account handle

4. You’ll know you’ve successfully connected when you receive this confirmation message:

Confirmation window that your Bluesky account has been connected to Discord

An Unknown Error Occurred. Maybe check your handle?

If we can’t find a Bluesky account associated with the handle you enter, you'll see an error message like this:

Error example when the wrong handle has been entered

This usually means you’ve made a typo when entering the handle, so please make sure to double-check the account name that you have entered. 

If your account uses a custom domain or custom PDS, see Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky below for more details. Otherwise, it’s possible that you may be hitting a temporary server error due to excessive load on the Bluesky network and you’ll have to try connecting your Bluesky account again later.

Using a Custom Domain with Bluesky

In order to link a Bluesky account with a custom-domain handle, Discord will need to look up your account’s DID. This happens when you initially connect the Bluesky account on Discord and then on an ongoing basis to keep your account connected to Discord. 

Verification happens in the same way described in the AT Protocol documentation and the Bluesky blog.

When verifying a domain using the /.well-known/atproto-did method, Discord will use a user-agent string in the form of Discord/1.0 (Discord API; +https://discordapp.com. 

Please ensure that your web server does not block requests with this user-agent, or severely rate-limit requests to this endpoint.

You can simulate the request Discord will make to verify your handle using a curl command in this form: curl -H 'User-Agent: Discord/1.0 (Discord API; +https://discordapp.com)' https://{your-handle-here}/.well-known/atproto-did

Custom PDS Providers

Discord supports linking AT Protocol accounts hosted by third-party PDS providers in the same way as accounts hosted by Bluesky. If hosting your own PDS, please ensure that your web server allows Discord’s user-agent on the authentication and PDS data endpoints, in addition to the /.well-known/atproto-did endpoint.

did:web: accounts

Discord also supports linking AT Protocol accounts that use did:web: identifiers. The requirements for the /.well-known/atproto-did endpoint also apply to the /.well-known/did.json endpoint.

Note: If you run into any issues with linking your Bluesky account to your Discord account, please reach out to our support team through here: http://dis.gd/contact

articles.name: Evolving Nitro Badges
articles.title: Evolving Nitro Badges
articles.body:
Learn about Discord Nitro's evolving profile badges, which show how long you've been a Nitro subscriber and automatically update to celebrate your membership milestones.

What this article covers:
  • What are Evolving Nitro Badges?
  • How Evolving Badges Work
  • Checking Your Nitro Badge Progress
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What are Evolving Nitro Badges?

Evolving Nitro Badges can only be viewed on the desktop version of Discord.

All Nitro subscribers get a special profile badge when they sign up for Nitro. If you’re subscribed to Nitro, your profile badge will evolve to showcase different designs with each milestone that you reach. 

NOTE: The evolving version of the Nitro badge is not available for Nitro Basic or Classic. 

How Evolving Badges Work

Your Nitro badge will automatically evolve once you’ve reached each subscription milestone. The badge that displays on your profile will be the most recent milestone that you’ve reached. 

Nitro Milestone Badge Evolution

If your Nitro subscription ends at any time and you resubscribe later, your badge progression will start fresh from the beginning. This means you'll need to maintain an active subscription to maintain your badge progress.

Checking Your Nitro Badge Progress

To check your current badge level and when you'll reach the next milestone, just hover your cursor over the badge on your profile. You can also check your progress under Direct Messages > Nitro Tab.

Evolving Profile Badge in Nitro Tab

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What happens to my badge if I cancel or end my Nitro subscription?

A: If you cancel your Nitro subscription, your badge progression will reset. When you resubscribe, you'll start fresh from the beginning of the badge progression.

NOTE: The Discord Support team does not have the ability to update, change, or restore the evolving Nitro badge or any previous badge progress under any circumstances.

Q: Can I keep my evolved badge if I switch between Nitro and Nitro Basic?

A: The evolving version of the Nitro profile badge is only available with Nitro. If you decide to switch your subscription to Nitro Basic, your badge progression will reset and will not evolve. If you re-subscribe to Nitro after subscribing to Nitro Basic, you will start fresh from the beginning of the badge progression. 

Q: How do I view my current badge progress?

A: Simply hover your cursor over the Nitro badge on your profile to see your current level and when you'll reach the next milestone or visit Direct Messages > Nitro Tab > press on the Evolving Profile Badge card to view where you are in the progression of available badges.

Q: Can I choose which badge design to display?

A: No, the badge that is displayed on your profile will be the last milestone you reached and cannot be manually selected.

Q: Can I hide or remove my Nitro badge?

A: No, the Nitro badge cannot be hidden or removed from your profile once earned.

articles.name: Emoji Confetti FAQ
articles.title: Emoji Confetti FAQ
articles.body:
Want to make a Discord message stand out? Emoji Confetti lets you add pizzazz to any message! Sharing your epic gaming moments or posting server announcements is going to be a lot more fun and memorable.

What this article covers:
  • What is Emoji Confetti?
  • Why and When should I use Emoji Confetti?
  • How do I apply Emoji Confetti to a message?
  • Frequently Asked Questions

What is Emoji Confetti?

Emoji Confetti is an experimental feature currently available to select desktop users.

Emoji Confetti adds eye-catching flair to your Discord messages. Pick an emoji and watch it burst as confetti on any message—yours or someone else's—to make it stand out with personality and pizzazz.

Example of Emoji Confetti

Why and When should I use Emoji Confetti?

Emoji Confetti turns ordinary messages into extraordinary ones, going beyond standard emoji reactions to create more fun moments and interactions in your conversations.

Here are moments where adding Emoji Confetti to a message can be a game-changer:

  • Celebrations: If someone posted a message of a gaming milestone or accomplishing a personal goal, shower that message with emoji confetti!
  • Special Announcements: Make important messages stand out in busy conversations or dedicated announcement channels.
  • Spreading Joy & Appreciation: Add confetti to messages to brighten someone’s day or show your appreciation.
  • Just for Fun: Sometimes a conversation needs that extra touch of magic - no special occasion required!

How do I apply Emoji Confetti to a message?

1. To apply Emoji Confetti to a message, select the Add Emoji Confetti icon [] when hovering over a posted message or in the lower-right corner of the text box while typing.

Add Emoji Confetti Icon While Hovering a Message or in Text Chat 

NOTE: As part of this experiment, start your Emoji Confetti fun with 2 free Emoji Confetti!

2. To add Emoji Confetti when typing a message, press the emoji icon [] in the Select an emoji to apply to your message banner located above the text box. Then, choose an emoji from the emoji picker. 

Selecting the Emoji Icon in the Banner Above the Text Box

For a posted message, pick an emoji using the Pick Emoji box. Then, choose an emoji from the emoji picker.

Selecting the Pick Emoji Box to and Choosing an Emoji from the Picker

3. Once you've sent your message or applied confetti to an existing message, you're all set! Hover over the emoji on a message with Emoji Confetti applied to cause an explosion of confetti!

Hovering over Messages with Emoji Confetti

Ready for even more fun? Get a pack of 5 additional Emoji Confetti for $0.99. To purchase more, simply open the Emoji Confetti menu by selecting the Add Emoji Confetti icon [] and press Get 5 more for $0.99.

Get 5 more for $0.99 Button in Emoji Confetti Menu

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What platforms is Emoji Confetti available on?

A: Currently, Emoji Confetti can only be applied to messages on desktop devices.

Q: Is there a way to disable the Emoji Confetti explosion?

A: The confetti explosion is an opt-in effect that you can choose to trigger. You can disable the Emoji Confetti effect and reduce motion across the app by going to your User Settings > Accessibility > toggle Enable Reduced Motion. You can learn more about reduced motion here.

Q: What’s your refund policy for Emoji Confetti?

A: Emoji Confetti is non-refundable—we cannot provide refunds after purchase or use.

Q: Can I see who applied Emoji Confetti to a message?

A: Yes—simply hover your cursor over the CONFETTI badge on a message to see who applied it.

Example of CONFETTI Badge

Q: Can everyone in the server see Emoji Confetti on a message?
A: Yes, everyone in the server can see Emoji Confetti on a message and trigger the effect. However, Emoji Confetti that you trigger will only appear for you.

Q: Can I remove or change Emoji Confetti after applying it?
A: No, once you’ve applied Emoji Confetti to a message, it cannot be removed or modified.

Q: What happens to Emoji Confetti after the experiment ends?

A: As an experimental feature, Emoji Confetti on messages and any remaining in your inventory may expire in the future.

articles.name: Winter Ringtone and Sounds 2024 FAQ
articles.title: Winter Ringtone and Sounds 2024 FAQ
articles.body:
Note: This sound pack is available on desktop only. This is not available for iOS and Android at this time.

Another year - another happy holiday season! We'll be exchanging our normal Discord call tone for something cheerier. So grab a friend and give them a call, or have them call you! Listen for festive and merry sound effects throughout as well!

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How long will this sound pack be available?

A: The Winter sound pack will be available from December 19, 2024 - January 3, 2025.

Q: Where can I enable this sound pack?

A: The Winter sound pack should be available automatically.

If you've disabled the Holiday sound pack, you can re-enable it. Go to User Settings > Notifications.

Then select ❄️ Winter from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

Winter Event Sound Pack in Notifications Settings

Q: Will this be available on all devices and clients?

A: The Winter sound pack will be available only on our desktop and browser clients. This soundpack is not available for iOS and Android at this time.

Q: Can I disable this sound pack and revert back to the default sound pack?

A: For desktop users, you'll be able to go to User Settings > Notifications. Then select Discord Default from the Event Sound Pack dropdown menu.

How to Revert Event Sound Pack to Discord Default in Notifications Settings

Note: If you have the Incoming Ring setting disabled, this will also automatically disable the Winter sound pack.

Q: Can I download this sound pack?

A: Sadly, there is no downloadable file for the sound pack and is only available in-client until January 3, 2025.

articles.name: Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
articles.title: Safe Ways to Shop on Discord
articles.body:
Looking for safe ways to buy Discord Nitro and other premium features? Learn how to protect your account and payment information by purchasing through official Discord channels only.

From accessing Nitro perks to enjoying premium features, ensuring your purchases are made through authorized platforms is key to protecting your Discord account.

Purchases from unauthorized sellers can potentially lead to revoked purchases or compromised personal and payment information. This article will help you understand the official ways to purchase Discord products and stay safe while enjoying all that Discord has to offer.

What this article covers:
  • Official Ways to Buy or Receive Discord Products
  • What Can You Do If You Suspect You’ve Been Scammed?
    • How to Stay Informed to Stay Safe
  • Frequently Asked Questions

Official Ways to Buy or Receive Discord Products

The secure way to purchase Nitro or other Discord products is directly through Discord or our official Amazon store (available in select countries).

Here’s how you can purchase or receive Nitro and other products on Discord:

  • Direct Purchase: Buy Nitro and Server Boosts through the Nitro Tab in your Direct Messages List or under User Settings > Billing Settings 
  • Gift Inventory: Check and manage your purchased or received Nitro gifts within the app. Gifts sent through Discord can only be redeemed on the platform. Learn how to securely claim a Nitro gift in our Nitro Gifting FAQ.
  • Profile Purchases: Customize your experience by purchasing Profile Cosmetics and Effects through the Shop Tab in your Direct Messages List or under User Settings > Profile
  • Share Nitro Program: As a subscription perk for Nitro subscribers, you can share three 2-week trial passes with friends who don't already have Nitro. This official program is a secure way to spread the fun. For more details, check out our Share Nitro article.
  • Quests and Promotions: We're proud of Nitro and want you to experience it firsthand! That's why we regularly offer opportunities to try it before buying. Check out our Quests & Promotions page to see all current offers.

If you ever encounter a promotion or offer for Nitro, make sure it comes from one of the trusted sources outlined above. Avoid clicking on suspicious links or interacting with third-party sellers offering discounts or giveaways.

Discord's premium products can only be purchased directly through the Discord app or our official Amazon store (available in select countries). Buying Discord Nitro or other official products from unauthorized sources puts you at risk of scams.

What Can You Do If You Suspect You’ve Been Scammed? 

If you suspect you’ve been scammed or purchased Discord products from an unauthorized seller:

1. Contact Support: Reach out to our support team at https://dis.gd/billing for assistance.

2. Report Fraud: Report the issue at https://dis.gd/howtoreport to help us take action against scammers.

Please note that Discord cannot mediate financial disputes or issue refunds for purchases made through unauthorized third-party sellers.

How to Stay Informed to Stay Safe

Scammers are constantly looking for ways to exploit users. Always double-check that your purchases and gifts come from the official Discord sources described in this article. For more guidance on avoiding scams, check out these resources:

  • Understanding and Avoiding Common Scams
  • Deceptive Practices Policy Explainer
  • Claiming a Nitro Gift FAQ
  • Shop FAQ
  • Server Boosting FAQ

By staying vigilant and following these tips, you can enjoy Discord’s premium features with peace of mind.

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: How do you identify a third-party seller?

A: Third-party sellers are unauthorized individuals or websites that offer Discord products at discounted prices or through unofficial channels. These sellers often advertise through unsolicited messages, social media, or unofficial websites. To identify them, look for offers that require external payments, unusual URLs, or methods that don’t involve the Discord app or official Amazon store. Remember: if it’s not from a Discord source described in this article, it’s not official.

Q: What does a phishing attempt look like?

A: Phishing attempts often appear as fake messages or links designed to trick you into providing sensitive information, like your login credentials or payment details. Common signs include:

  • Messages claiming you’ve won or received free products or rewards, like Nitro, but requiring you to click a suspicious link.
  • Threats to your account status unless you take immediate action.
  • Requests for your password, account login, or personal information.

Discord will never ask for your login details or for your payment information through unsolicited messages. Always verify links and contact Discord support directly if you’re unsure.

Q: What are safe messaging practices to avoid unsolicited scams?

A: To protect yourself from unsolicited messages and scams:

  • Avoid engaging with messages from unknown users, especially those offering deals or rewards.
  • Enable Safe Direct Messaging under User Settings > Privacy & Safety to automatically scan DMs from non-friends for harmful content.
  • Report suspicious messages or users by following the steps outlined here.
  • Never click on links from untrusted sources. Even if they appear to come from someone you know, accounts can be compromised.

If you ever need to verify if a source is a legitimate Discord source or not, you can reach out to the Discord support team.

articles.name: Why Does My Payment Show As A Pending Charge?
articles.title: Why Does My Payment Show As A Pending Charge?
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • What is a Pending Charge?
  • What if I See Multiple Pending Charges?

What is a Pending Charge?

Example of a Pending purchase in the Billing tab

If you see a pending charge on Discord, this indicates that the charge was unsuccessful because it requires further verification from your bank or card provider. You’ll need to reach out to your payment provider for steps on how to correct this pending charge. 

If the pending charge isn't resolved, it will automatically cancel within 3 days. The status of the charge will then change to Failed in your User Settings > Billing. If a pending charge still appears on your bank statement, it should be removed within 5-10 business days.

What if I see Multiple Pending Charges?

The only time you may see multiple pending charges are when your payments have not been successfully processed, or they’re in a Past Due state. 

When renewing a subscription and your renewal payment does not successfully go through, we will attempt the purchase again to ensure that your subscription goes uninterrupted. Once a payment successfully goes through, our system will attempt to cancel all other pending payments. 

Note: If you are still seeing the pending charge after 10 business days, you can reach out to the Billing Support team for them to review through here: dis.gd/billing

articles.name: Why is My Payment Showing as Failed or Invalid?
articles.title: Why is My Payment Showing as Failed or Invalid?
articles.body:
What this article covers:
  • Why is My Payment Showing As Failed?
  • Why is My Payment showing as Invalid Payment?

Why is my Payment Showing As Failed?

Billing tab under User Settings on desktop/browser

There are several reasons that can cause a payment to fail. To figure out what’s going on, we recommend following the steps below:

1. Ensure that the billing address associated with the card being charged is current and matches the information filed with your bank. You can learn how to manage your billing information here.

2. Ensure your card details are entered correctly.

3. Ensure the card hasn’t expired.

4. Depending on the card, ensure there are sufficient funds in the account or that the credit limit hasn’t been exceeded.

5. It’s possible a pre-set spending limit on the card was reached. Double-check if a spending limit has been set.

Note: If issues persist after following the steps above, Discord's Support team cannot provide further assistance. We recommend contacting your bank or using another payment method.

Why is my Payment showing as Invalid Payment?

If you’re receiving an Invalid payment error message, it means there is an error with the payment method you are trying to use. Please review the information you provided and try again. 

Example of an Invalid payment message when making a purchase

Note: If you’re still getting an error message, please reach out to our Support team for further assistance through here: dis.gd/billing

articles.name: Discord Nitro Trial for Streamlabs Users
articles.title: Discord Nitro Trial for Streamlabs Users
articles.body:
Starting from December 18, 2024 (12PM PT) to March 18, 2025 (12PM PT), Streamlabs users can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro, while Streamlabs Ultra subscribers can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro. Learn below about how you can claim Discord Nitro.

Promotion Summary

Offer Details: 1 month of Discord Nitro for Streamlabs users, or 3 months for Streamlabs Ultra subscribers

Who is Eligible: Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

We will not be able to refund any leftover membership time from those, and the user will be forfeiting the remainder of the existing membership when activating the 1 month or 3 month Nitro trial.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Requirements: Claim through Streamlabs by March 18, 2025 (12PM PT), and redeem in your Discord account by April 18, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Membership: After the 1 month or 3 month trial period, your Nitro membership will convert to a monthly recurring membership, and Discord will bill your payment method per month until you cancel it. You can cancel at any time in your Discord User Settings. 

What this article covers:
  • What is Discord Nitro?
  • What is Streamlabs?
  • How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Streamlabs account?  
  • How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account? 
    • Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial
    • Step by Step Redeem Instructions
      • What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 
  • Frequently Asked Questions
    • Promotion Details
    • Eligibility for the Promotion
    • Payment Info and Membership Questions
    • Potential Errors and Other Issues

What is Discord Nitro?

Discord Nitro is our membership plan that gives you access to special perks that’ll make your time on Discord as fun as ever! Personalize and enhance your experience with popular perks like HD streaming, 500MB file uploads, profile and avatar customizations, 2 free Server Boosts, and more:

  • Custom Emojis
  • Discord App Color Themes
  • Super Reactions
  • Avatar Decorations
  • Unique Server Profiles
  • Server Boosts
  • More Nitro & Nitro Basic perks

What is Streamlabs?

Streamlabs is a leading provider of live streaming tools and a brand of Logitech. It offers everything a creator needs to go live and grow their audience on platforms like Twitch, YouTube, TikTok, and more. With Streamlabs, content creators can engage with their viewers, monetize their streams, and manage all aspects of their live streams in one place.

Streamlabs offers a comprehensive suite of free tools and features to support content creators' live streaming journey. These include free broadcasting and recording software, tip pages, live alerts, chatbots, and more.

How do I claim the Nitro Promo from my Streamlabs account?

1. To claim your Nitro Promo, log in to Streamlabs.com using your Streamlabs ID or connect to a third-party platform.

2. You'll find the promotional card on the right side of your dashboard.

3. Press the claim button and you will be redirected to a Discord web page to complete the process. 

Your unique code will be automatically created upon pressing the claim button.

How do I redeem the Nitro Trial on my Discord Account?

Once you have claimed the promo, you'll now need to officially redeem this promo on your Discord account. You must redeem this Nitro trial by April 18, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

Eligibility for Redeeming the Nitro Trial

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Users who have had an active Nitro membership or Nitro trial in the last 12 months are not eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Users who have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on their accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If a user has had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on their account and they’ve never had a Nitro membership, redeeming this promotion will override that membership.

Users who have already claimed a gift from this promotion are not eligible to claim further gifts from this promotion.

Step by Step Redeem Instructions

If you're eligible and ready to redeem this Nitro membership on your own Discord account, you can follow these steps below to redeem the promo.

NOTE:
- Before redeeming Nitro, make sure you are logged in your own Discord account.
- If you accidentally redeemed the Nitro promo on an account that is not yours, we are unable to provide you with another promo.

Step 1 - Logging into Discord

  •  If you're not already logged into Discord in your browser, you will then be automatically redirected to either:

Register for a New Account

If you don't have an account, you can directly register a new Discord account

Login to your Account

If you already have a Discord account, you can login to your account using your email and password or using QR code login

Step 2 - Claiming your promotion gift

Once you have logged in to your account, you will see a message asking you to claim your promotion gift. 

The account you are currently logged in as will receive this gift. This gift cannot be shared with a friend and once claimed, the gift cannot be switched to a different user, so be sure you are on the account you want to claim the gift for. If you want to change to a different account, press on the Switch Accounts.

Press on Next when you’re ready to redeem your gift on your chosen account.

Step 3 - Redeeming your promotion gift

Review the details of the promotion then press on Next. Please note: if you switch to a different account at this step, you will not be able to claim and redeem the promotion on the account you switched to. 

Make sure your payment information is accurate. If your Discord account does not have your payment information, please fill out your payment details. You will not be charged until the trial ends and the membership renews.

When you've filled out all the necessary information and you're ready to redeem this promotion, press the confirmation button.

Step 4 - Membership Now Activated

After accepting the promo to your account, you'll now be automatically redirected to your Subscriptions tab in your User Settings to see your newly activated Nitro membership on your account.

What if I am an Active Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting Member? 

Just to clarify - if you have had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your account and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

So long as you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership, you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 month or 3 month Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 month or 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Frequently Asked Questions

We know there's a lot of information to unpack on this promotion above, so we've also broken down this information in this FAQ section as well too.

  • Promotion Details
  • Eligibility for the Promotion
  • Payment Info and Membership Questions
  • Potential Errors and Other Issues
    • Already Had/Have Nitro
    • Already Redeemed
    • Something's Wrong Here

Promotion Details

Q: How long does this promotion run for?

A: Streamlabs users can claim Discord Nitro promo between December 18, 2024 (12PM PT)] to March 18, 2025 (12PM PT).

After March 18, 2025 (12PM PT), Streamlabs users will no longer be able to claim a trial promo.

Q: How long does the Discord Nitro promotion last for?

A: You must redeem the Nitro promotion by April 18, 2025 (11:59PM PT).

If a code has not been redeemed to the Discord account by April 18, 2025 (11:59PM PT), it will expire and you will no longer be able to have 1 or 3 month[s] of Discord Nitro.

Eligibility for the Promotion

Q: Who can claim this promotion from their Streamlabs account?

A: All Streamlabs users can claim 1 month of Discord Nitro, while Streamlabs Ultra subscribers can claim 3 months of Discord Nitro.

1. To claim your Nitro Promo, log in to Streamlabs.com using your Streamlabs ID or connect to a third-party platform.

2. You'll find the promotional card on the right side of your dashboard.

3. Press the claim button and you will be redirected to a Discord web page to complete the process. 

Q: Who can redeem this Nitro trial to their Discord account?

A: Users who have never had an active Nitro membership on their Discord accounts are eligible to redeem this Nitro promotion.

Additionally, users who previously had a Discord Nitro membership and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months are ineligible.

This promotion is only available in certain regions. If you receive an "Unknown Gift Code" error during the claim/redemption process, you are not eligible to redeem this promotion. You can learn more at this Help Center article.

Q: What if I'm a current or previous Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or a Server Boost membership? Can I also take part in this promotion? 

A: If you previously had a Discord Nitro membership at any point on your accounts and have had a Nitro Classic or Nitro Basic membership in the past 12 months, you are ineligible to redeem this promotion.

If you have had a Nitro Basic, Nitro Classic, or Server Boosting membership active on your account and you’ve never had a Nitro membership,  you will be able to redeem this promotion and replace it with the 1 or 3 month[s] Nitro membership.

HOWEVER, please note: By choosing to activate this 1 or 3 month trial, you will lose any features associated with your current memberships, and **you will not receive a refund for any remaining value on your current membership**.

At the end of the promotion period, you'll be converted to a paying Nitro membership per month unless you cancel your membership.

Payment Info and Membership Questions

Q: Why do I need to submit my payment info to redeem Nitro?

A: Because Nitro is a membership plan, at the end of your 1 or 3 month trial, we will start your first billing cycle so you can continue to enjoy Nitro on Discord.

However, you can cancel the Nitro membership at any time before the end of the 1 or 3 month[s].

Q: Why do I see a temporary hold/charge on my account when this is supposed to be a free promotion?

A: Just to clarify, this Nitro promotion is free, however, there will be a temporary hold placed on the payment method upon activating the promotion. This is to help Discord confirm the payment method works as expected and to prevent the use of fraudulent payment methods. This charge will appear in your Discord transaction history, and it may appear as a hold on your payment method.

We immediately reverse the temporary hold, and you’ll see that reflected in your Discord transaction history. Your bank may take longer to remove the hold from your payment method.

NOTE: Banks will usually remove the temporary hold from your account within a few business days.

If your Discord transaction history does not show the hold released after 5 business days, please let us know at https://dis.gd/contact, and our support team will be able to investigate this issue further.

Potential Errors and Other Issues

Q: I see a "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an "Oh no! It looks like you have Nitro already" error, that means that the Discord account you're trying to redeem this promotion on currently has a Nitro membership so it is ineligible for this Nitro promotion.

Please make sure you're logged into the account that you want to redeem this promotion on.

Q: I see a "Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub!" error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Sorry, looks like you’ve already had a Nitro sub” error, that means that you've previously subscribed to Nitro on your Discord account and you won't be able to redeem this 1 or 3 month[s] perk.

If you have never subscribed to Nitro, please submit a ticket through our support system: https://dis.gd/contact and our support team will be able to investigate further.

Be sure to include your full Discord ID and email address tied to your Discord account.

Q: I see a "This gift has already been claimed" error when I try to claim my Nitro promo.

A: If you are seeing a "This gift has been claimed already" error, that means that the Nitro promo has already been used and cannot be used again. You may need to double check if you've claimed this promo on another Discord account.

Unfortunately, once the promo has been claimed, the promo cannot be re-enabled, and the Nitro cannot be transferred from one account to another.

Q: I see a "Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work." error when I try to redeem my Nitro promo.

A: If you're seeing an “Wait a Second...Looks like this code didn't work.” error, that means that the promo is invalid.

Please note that our support team is unable to intervene if you are given an invalid promo and we will not be able to provide a new promo.

Q: I see a “Looks like something went wrong” error when I click on “Next”.

A: There are several reasons why you may be seeing this error:

  • You are ineligible for this promotion
  • The promotion is invalid
  • The promotion has reached the maximum number of claims
  • The link is invalid

Please note that the Discord support team is not able to assist if you run into this error when attempting to redeem. See the list above for possible reasons why your account may be ineligible or otherwise unable to redeem this promotion.

Q: I see a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you're seeing a "Sorry, This Payment Source Cannot Be Used for Redemption" error, that means that the payment method you've selected to cover the temporary $1 hold cannot be used for that purpose. 

Please keep in mind that prepaid payment methods, such as Gcash, cannot be used to cover temporary holds due to the nature of how prepaid payment methods function.

For more information on temporary holds, please check out this article!

Q: I see a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error when trying to redeem my promo!

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like this promotion has reached its maximum number of claims” error, that means the maximum limit for claims of this promotion has been reached and this promotion can no longer be claimed. If you have claimed this Nitro promotion, you are still able to redeem it to your Discord account!

Please note that the support team is unable to assist you if you run into this error and we are not able to increase the limit of claims.

Q: I see a “Looks like your email isn’t verified. Make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift.”

A: If you are seeing a “Looks like your email isn’t verified, make sure to verify your email before claiming this gift” error, you are trying to redeem this Nitro promotion on a Discord account with an email that hasn’t been verified yet.

You can check out this support article on how to resend the email verification for your Discord account. If you need help setting up your Discord account, you can read our Getting Started article. 

Q: I’m having trouble with my Streamlabs account.

A: Contact Streamlabs’ support team by submitting a ticket at https://support.streamlabs.com/hc/en-us/requests/new and select the Other category.
